abstract: The streaming video software developer Move Networks has emerged from stealth mode to announce its first institutional round of venture funding, an $11.3 million installment intended to spur the company to positive cash flow by year’s end. Steamboat Ventures, Walt Disney‘s investment arm, and Hummer Winblad Venture Partners co-led the round.
lead_paragraph: The streaming video software developer Move Networks has emerged from stealth mode to announce its first institutional round of venture funding, an $11.3 million installment intended to spur the company to positive cash flow by year’s end. Steamboat Ventures, Walt Disney‘s investment arm, and Hummer Winblad Venture Partners co-led the round.
